revised_title: Observations on the Variations of Gravity at St. Helena
tldr: The author, Nevil Maskelyne, conducts an experiment at St. Helena to measure the variation of gravity at different latitudes using a clock made by John Shelton. The results show that the clock loses 11 seconds per day, and the author concludes that the variation of gravity is due to both centrifugal force and the Earth's figure.
